meanings.definition: A person or thing that holds something together or serves as the central cohesive element.
meanings.sent1: In our group project, Sarah was the lynchpins that kept us organized and on track.
meanings.sent2: The family's traditions were the lynchpins that united them during the holidays.
meanings.sent3: The lynchpins of the puzzle were missing, so we couldn't complete it.
meanings.sent4: Her positive attitude acted as the lynchpins that held the team's morale together.
meanings.sent5: The secret ingredient was the lynchpins that made the recipe unforgettable.

meanings.definition: A pin passed through the end of an axle to keep a wheel in position.
meanings.sent1: The mechanic carefully inserted the lynchpins to secure the wheel in place.
meanings.sent2: Make sure to check the lynchpins regularly to prevent any accidents while driving.
meanings.sent3: The lynchpins were so rusty that they were stuck in the axle.
meanings.sent4: Without the lynchpins, the wheel wobbled dangerously on the road.
meanings.sent5: The lynchpins were the small but crucial parts that kept the entire machine running smoothly.
